item.description:
8-20-11   Due to the rain today and maybe overnight and tomorrow parts of the trail I was thinking of using might be underwater so we won't be starting the hike from the jersey barriers as I was planning yesterday.  Instead if you follow these directions it will get you to the 3rd gate we usually start this hike from on Tower Hill Rd.  However due to the jersey barriers at the highway under pass we will need to come in from the other end of Tower Hill Road which is in Candia.

If you are on 101 heading east towards Candia get off at exit 2 and take a right at the end of the ramp.

If  you are on 101 heading west towards Manchester get of at exit 2 and take a left at the end of the ramp.

Pass Holidays Bar and Grill which will be on your left.  

Turn left onto Old Candia Road which  just a little ways past Holidays.  

Proceed 1.5 miles on Old Candia Road (at  0.4 miles you will be passing the usual entrance we take to get onto Tower Hill Road).

Turn left onto Chester Turnpike and proceed 2.0 miles.

Turn left onto Tower Hill Road.  There is a tree trunk missing it's top that is about 15 feet tall at the intersection.   The tree is on the right.  The sign for Tower Hill Road is hard to see as it is set back on the road and is not an official town sign.

Proceed 1.5 miles on Tower Hill Road which is a dirt road.  At  1.5 miles you will come to 2 signs saying the road is closed and the gate is right there very near the signs.  You can actually drive another 0.3 miles on the road before you come to the jersey barrier blocking the highway underpass. At the Auburn end of Tower Hill Road.
item.how_to_find_us: Park near the 3rd gate on the left as you drive up Tower Hill Road.

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Tower Hill Pond Loop
